value.value: Few of the many wonders in the state of Himachal Pradesh in India are the several lakes in the remotest and unthinkable of locations possible. One such lake is the Bhrigu Lake, fabled to have been the meditation grounds of the famous Sage Bhrigu, the lake is considered holy in the Indian Mythology because it is believed that the sage himself used to bathe in the waters. This tour takes you through the famous trek to the Bhrigu lake and crosses over the Rohtang Pass and lets you camp in the wild on this once in a lifetime expedition to the holy lake.

• Enjoy this wonderful trek to Bhrigu Lake as this is one of the most famous treks in Himachal, you will gather beautiful memories as you trek to this beautiful lake.
  • The journey begins with your arrival in Manali, from where you will begin your trek to Rohlikohli Campsite
  • The second day sees you taking onto the bigger challenge, the trek to the Bhrigu Lake at about 14000ft above sea level
  • After this, you will trek back to the campsite the same day, and the next day, you will further trek downhill to reach Gulaba where your ride to Manali will be waiting for you/
  • This day, you will end the experience after reaching Manali.

value.heading: Day 1 - Drive from Manali to Gulaba | Trek to Rohlikohli campsite
value.value:
• Arrive in the Manali early in the morning and meet our representative who will transfer you to Gulaba.
  • From here, you will trek to reach your campsite in Rohlikohli.
  • The ascend till Rohlikohli is moderate and will take around 3 - 4 hours to reach. There are two streams on the way to the campsite (Chor Nallah and Kohli Nallah). Rohli Kohli is a beautiful campsite and offers amazing views of the Solang Valley.
  • Overnight stay in tents at Rohli Kohli Camp Site.

value.heading: Day 2 - Bhrigu lake trek (12 kms and about 9 hours)
value.value:
• Starting early in the morning, you will have your breakfast and start the trek to the lake with packed lunch
  • The trek will take about 3 hours one-way. After reaching the site of the lake, you will have lunch there and admire the scenic beauty of your surroundings.
  • Post this, you will start your descent to the campsite
  • After reaching the camp, rest of the day is for you to relax in your tents.
  • Dinner and overnight stay in Camp

value.heading: Day 3 - Trek back to Gulaba and Departure
value.value:
• On the last day of this trek, you will check out of the camps after breakfast and begin the descent to Gulaba.
  • A vehicle from here will take you back to Manali where the experience comes to an end.

details.heading: Meals
details.value:
• From dinner on Day 1 to Lucnh on Day 3, all meals will be arranged
  • A lot of emphasis is given to nutritional needs and a menu of vegetarian dishes is prepared accordingly.
  • Tea/coffee will be served throughout.

details.heading: Other Inclusion
details.value:
• High quality trekking equipment’s (Tents, Mattress, Sleeping bags)
  • Camping stools Aid, Medical Kit, First Aid Kit
  • Forest Permits/Camping Charges
  • Trek guide
  • Bonfire

details.heading: Transport
details.value: Toyota Innova, Mahindra Xylo, Mahindra Scorpio, Tempo Traveller and no local jeeps or similar vehicles are used except where there are short transfers from the lodge to the trek points. The transport tariff includes all driver charges, fuel, parking, toll and taxes.

details.heading: Things To Carry
details.value:
• A sturdy backpack (60ltrs) with a plastic or water-proof lining
  • High-ankle waterproof (Goretex)trekking shoes with good grip
  • Trekking pole or stick
  • Wardrobe essentials like woollen and fleece clothes, synthetic or waterproof track pants, rain-proof jackets, sunglasses, waterproof gloves, wind-proof jackets, thermal innerwear
  • Moisturizer, Sun Screen Lotion, Lip Balm
  • Personal Medicine Kit
  • Insulated water bottle and hydration pack (optional)
  • Torch / Flashlight (with extra batteries)
  • Extra Polythene bags

details.heading: Clothing
details.value:
• 1 pair of thermals (upper + lower)
  • 2 pairs of Quick Dry Warm lower or Track Pants.
  • Full sleeves T-shirts/ Sweatshirts.
  • 2-3 pair of socks
  • Undergarments. Qty - 1 for every day of trekking
  • 1 warm/feather jacket
  • Gloves and head cover

details.heading: Advisory
details.value:
• Travel in small groups
  • Proper waste disposal
  • Respect local cultures and be sensitive towards wildlife
  • Porter services for carrying personal belongings throughout the trek (not more than 10 kgs) are optional additions that can be availed for Rs. 800
  • Personal trekking gear and that can be availed at an additional cost
  • General precautions and steps are to be taken to initiate good acclimatization with the assistance of guides
  • Those suffering from an ailment or heart disease, Diabetes, breathing problems, high altitude sickness or is pregnant cannot participate in this trek
